website_summaries.verdict: The Epson PowerLite 1751 is a modestly priced slim-and-light portable data projector with very good video image quality, and data image quality suitable for typical business use.

customer_reviews.title: Creates Fantastic Viewing Experience
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a bright, full screen projection for seminar participants. The Epson PowerLite 1771W fulfilled all my expectations. It's small and compact for a road warrior, and wonderful to view. As I walked down the hall and looked into conference rooms during PMI Mega SeminarsWorld, most screens were partly filled and dull. Our room was in marked contrast with a beautiful display.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Good display but no audio out to connect external speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Display is excellent & overall Product is good. Main disadvantage is audio out is not present. This device is not good for those people who want to connect to external speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite pleased with this little one. It is slim and fits in my backpack next to my small laptop. I haven't find the way to just carry my presentation with a usb, but I'll try to upload my presentation as pictures and this may also take off a weight of my back. Works good even if the place is not 100% dark. Great deal. Nov 25, 2014. If you can add some money for the bluetooth option DO IT! I'm having a hard time connecting this nice projector to my cellphone or tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Ce Gzz

customer_reviews.title: ... set up the projector this morning and it is excellent. Very bright
customer_reviews.text: Just set up the projector this morning and it is excellent. Very bright, even in a sunlit room. Small enough to be quite portable. Autofocus, keystone, etc. makes it a breeze to set up. The only downside is that it ships with a CD with the drivers. Since many laptops today skip the CD drive, you have to be smart enough to go to the website the download the drivers. Don't confuse this with the cheap (sub $150) projectors. I tried two of them and there is absolutely no comparison. They are not meant for a professional presentation. This one is.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Friedman

customer_reviews.title: Size & Weight Perfect for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Awwsome for a traveling trainer as myself. The size and weight are perfect. I can put both my laptop and this projector in my computer bag. It is bright and clear and easy to use. I didnt need fancy bells and whistles so I am probably not using all of the features. I cant seem to get my USB to work with it so I am stuck using the prong connection. It comes with all the cords a remote and a thin bag to carry everything. This was definitely worth the purchase. I also checked the price of the bulb for future reference and its not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: M - Speaker

customer_reviews.title: Love this projector
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before making a final selection for purchase. This projector, as well as others in its family line, were highly rated for lots of reasons. And I concur with all of them. Great resolution, bright display, easy to use, compact, etc. The common negative feedback I saw was that the fan was loud. Someone equated it to a hair dryer when in "normal" mode. I find the fan to be completely acceptable, not loud at all in the "normal" mode. And like others, agree it is nearly silent in the power save mode. The fan noise is no problem for me. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Curt Freed

customer_reviews.title: Works well with beneficial features. A little noisy but tolerable.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The projected image is crisp and bright even in a lit room The image kerning capability enables you to have the projector not directly aligned with teh screen bu tstil get a square image The WiFi capability enables wireless peer to peer or internet enabled connect with another internet enabled device for live demos It has all the input types you need including USB It is under $1000 in price Cons: THe fan noise wil grate on some folks. It is more pronounced in a "close quarters" environment. Not bad at all in a more open presentation environment.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Nice little projector
customer_reviews.text: Nice little projector. Used for travelling. Noisier than my old ViewSonic, but lightweight. Picture is pretty bright. I have two of these at work.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Not much experience (1st I've owned / used regularly): Easy to set up; very bright (tested it in the daylight in a well lit room); smaller & lighter than expected. The provided remote has lots of functions, but I'm sticking with my own 3 button slide advance (laser, forward, back). Also got the 25' cable as recommend - good choice.
customer_reviews.author: R, an Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lighter and Thinner
customer_reviews.text: When you travel, weight and size do matter. This projector seems to have a balance of both at a reasonable price. As technology improves I am hoping that we can see Epson come out with a PICO with the lumen output I need but until then this should do. The bulb life is a concern with only 4,000 life hours it is a bit short and I will need to watch the clarity a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Dessler

customer_reviews.title: Love the self correcting keystone feature
customer_reviews.text: A definite upgrade from my 2004 model Hitachi projector. Much brighter, modern input ports. Love the self correcting keystone feature. Brick and mortar retailer office supply place OD/OM would have been less expensive with their $100 trade in credit for the old projectore, but I missed the offering window. Amazon definitely competitive with other offers at time of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. Brugler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase we made for our team that uses this projector, even for overseas use. The claim that you can use a USB drive and don't need a computer is a bit complicated because you have to download extra software to your computer. It isn't as easy as they make it sound. However, the projector itself is outstanding and I can't recommend it highly enough. Lighter than a business laptop and about the same size...so it fits into a computer case with a laptop, easily.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job

The quality is good but it takes some time to place it properly depending on the venue as it is not the easiest to zoom in and out. We ended up needing a 12' HDMI cable because we had to place it further out from the original position to make it properly fit to the screen. The projector does not come with a HDMI cable so you will need to buy that separately

customer_reviews.title: Great value, small lamp projector
customer_reviews.text: One of the most efficient and high value lamp projectors out there. It is roughly the size of a small laptop, and I travel with it a lot. LED projectors will one day replace this type because they are much smaller and more efficient, but currently the LED projector offerings are insufficiently bright. This one balances the brightness of a lamp projector with the smallness of a traveling projector.
customer_reviews.author: MMC

customer_reviews.title: It seemed like someone already opened it before it was delivered to ...
customer_reviews.text: When I received the projector, the box was not completely sealed. It seemed like someone already opened it before it was delivered to me. I think the projector is fine. The machine has gotten quite hot while I was watching a movie and the noise of the cooling fan (?) was a bit annoying. The image was not very clear when I set the projector about 3 m apart from the screen (and the screen width was also around 3m). I can watch the video and read subtitle well enough but it is difficult to read the title of the folder or file on the computer screen.

product_meta.title: Epson PowerLite 1751, XGA, 2600 Lumens Color Brightness, 2600 Lumens White Brightness, Ultra Lightweight 3LCD Projector
product_meta.description: Style:PowerLite 1751Brilliant XGA Performance in a Slim Ultraportable. Its sleek, lightweight design, XGA resolution and outstanding image quality make it easy for the Epson® PowerLite 1751to deliver brilliant presentations in the office or on the road. Offering the perfect combination of value and performance, the PowerLite 1751 features 2600 lumens color light output and 2600 lumens white light output for great presentations every time. Weighing just 3.7 lb and just 1.7" tall, this ultraportable projector is ready to travel when you are. Connecting is simple, on a Mac or PC, with USB Plug ‘n Play instant setup. The PowerLite 1751 also features HDMI connectivity to easily deliver both audio and brilliant video with just one cable. Use a USB memory device and deliver your presentation PC-free. Automatic vertical keystone correction makes setup easy. ThePowerLite 1751 is also equipped with a long life lamp that lasts up to 5000 hours. So you get amazing performance, ease of use and brilliant output — all from one ultra-thin projector.
feature_bullets: Lightweight and travel friendly — thin as a laptop, weighs just 3.7 lb
XGA performance — 2600 lumens color and 2600 lumens white light output, native XGA resolution
Easy connectivity — USB Plug ‘n Play — Windows and Mac compatible
HDMI connectivity — makes connecting to HDMI devices quick and easy
PC-free presentations — display directly from a USB memory device
